results.title: Those magnificent men in their flying machines or How I flew from London to Paris in 25 hours and 11 minutes
results.creator_credit: Ken Annakin, Stan Margulies and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This farcical comedy based loosely on the historic 1910 London to Paris air race features the greatest aviators from around the world. They all come together when a stuffy, but very rich, newspaper publisher decides to sponsor an airplane race across the English Channel. The often hilarious escapades between the American, British, French, German, Italian and Japanese teams results in some of the most daring and hilarious in-flight acrobatics ever filmed.

results.title: The Great dictator
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin and Charles Chaplin Productions
results.brief_description: Chaplin plays dual roles in what was his first dialogue film: a burlesque of Hitler alias Adenoid Hynkel, and a Jewish barber who returns an amnesiac many years after an accident in World War I, unaware of the rise of Nazism. The parody of Hitler draws not only on Chaplin’s genius for mime but also on his vocal resources. His most experimental work, the film was politically audacious for the times receiving a mixed reception in an America in the grip of isolationism but an enthusiastic one in blitzed London. Cast includes Paulette Goddard, Jack Oakie and Reginald Gardiner.

results.title: City lights
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin and Charles Chaplin Productions
results.brief_description: Chaplin once again revived the character of the Little Tramp for this, his last ‘silent’ film (save for a musical score and an occasional sound effect), released three years after the beginning of the talkie era. After falling in love with a blind flower girl who, through a series of coincidences comes to believes that he is a millionaire, the Tramp attempts to raise money for an operation to restore her vision. A melodrama that combines pathos with slapstick and comedy, ‘City Lights’ is widely regarded as Chaplin’s greatest film.

results.title: As young as you feel
results.creator_credit: Harmon Jones, Lamar Trotti and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: John Hodges (Monty Woolley) is a printer for the Acme Printing Company, who in turn are owned through various sub-siduaries by Consolidated Motors. This is where our problem begins… Consolidated Motors has a Personnel Policy stating “All workers over 65 have to retire”, and our John Hodges does not want to be forcibly retired and wants his job back. He wishes to fight for the principle of dignity - both in life and at work. “There is more to life than mere success” he attests, but how does he go about this courageous though some may say futile enterprise? He dyes his hair black and pays a visit to the offices of Mr McKinley, manager at Acme Printing, where he meets Marilyn Monroe as the company secretary in one of her first and funniest roles. Posing as President of Consolidated Motors in order to get the policy overturned, he finds himself feted and listened to as a elder statesman of the Business World. Cast also includes Thelma Ritter, David Wayne, Jean Peters, Constance Bennett and many others who give stirling performances, also includes a very young Russ Tamblyn.

results.title: When Harry met Sally...
results.creator_credit: Rob Reiner, Andrew Scheinman and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: Infamous for it’s restaurant scene that provokes the, “I’ll have what she’s having” line, this romantic comedy written by Nora Ephron follows the slowly developing relationship between Harry Burns (Billy Crystal) and Sally Albright (Meg Ryan). Harry and Sally meet in the 1970’s when they share a car trip courtesy of a mutual friend. They never run out of things to say, and Harry sticks by his proclamation that men cannot be friends with attractive women. Over the course of the next 10 years, both of them fall in and out of love, grow closer as friends, and contemplate a romantic future together when they cross the boundary between friends and lovers in a moment of emotional weakness. This film provided played a pivotal role in the renaissance of modern romantic comedy, led by Nora Ephron who went on to be involved in films such as “Sleepless in Seattle” and “You’ve got mail”, both of which featured Meg Ryan in the romantic lead. Cast also includes Carrie Fisher and Bruno Kirby.

results.title: The Wog boy
results.creator_credit: Aleksi Vellis, Nick Giannopoulos, John Brousek, Cinemedia and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Steve (Nick Giannopoulos) is an unemployed Greek man who becomes an unwitting scape goat for various political interest groups when he gets branded a dole cheat on a tabloid style current affairs program. His cause gets taken up by the Minister of employment Raelene Beagle- Thorpe (Geraldine Turner), who turns Steve into the poster boy for her campaign, while a romance blossoms between Steve and the Ministers Anglo aid, Celia (Lucy Bell). Anyone who is familiar with Nick Giannopoulos’s phenomenally successful stage show ‘Wogs out of work’, will find more of the same ground covered in ‘The Wog boy’ as the film broadly lampoons various Australian stereotypes about first and second generation migrants being a bunch of dole cheating, bludgers. Whether star Giannopoulos, director Aleksi Vellis and co-writer Chris Anastassiades achieve their aim of defusing these racist representations by mocking them will entirely depend on whether you think the old fashioned racial jokes on parade here are actually funny. Cast includes Vince Colosimo, Abi Tucker, Derryn Hinch, John Barresi, Hung Le. Special edition includes behind-the-scenes featurette.

results.title: Lets make love = The Billionaire
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Jerry Wald, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Artists
results.brief_description: Jean-Marc Clement (Yves Montand), bachelor, billionaire and womaniser, finds himself entrenched in the world of Broadway musicals when he is cast to play himself on Broadway. Discovering the news that he is to be satirised on stage, an outraged Clement heads to the theatre expecting a confrontation, but instead finds himself captivated by Amanda (Marilyn Monroe), one of the performers in the play, and despite his inability to sing, dance or act, accepts the offer of a role. Coached by some of the best in the business - Bing Crosby, Gene Kelly and Milton Berle, Clement sets out to make his mark on the stage as well as win the heart of the girl he loves without disclosing his true identity. Cast also includes Tony Randall (reprising his straight man role) as Clements PR agent. Includes the original theatrical trailer. Marilyn Monroe sings “My heart belongs to daddy”.

results.title: Flaming star
results.creator_credit: Don Siegel, David Weisbart and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Considered one of Elvis Presley’s most dramatic roles, “Flaming Star” is a story about Pacer Burton’s (Presley) struggle as a young man torn between two cultures. Set some years after the Civil War, the small community that Pacer lives in finds itself under siege from the Kiowa tribe. After several settlers are killed the community turns on Pacer and his family and Pacer is forced to choose between the community he grew up in and his Native American roots. His choice leads to tragedy for both sides. “Flaming Star” enables Presley to showcase his acting ability without the usual musical intermissions. Cast also includes Dolores Del Rio, John McIntire and Barbara Eden. Features the original theatrical trailer.

results.title: Love me tender
results.creator_credit: Robert D Webb, David Weisbart and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Love Me Tender is most noteable for being Elvis Presley’s cinematic debut and the launching pad for one of his most recognisable hits Love Me Tender. The story of the Reno brothers starts at the end of the Civil War. Presley is Clint Reno a young farmer trying to keep the family farm running after the family are told that the oldest brother, Vance Reno has been killed in battle. Believing his brother is dead, Clint and Vance’s sweetheart Kathy marry. However, Vance returns with the intention of marrying Kathy. Clint receives reassurance from Vance that he bears no resentment towards the pair. However, the trios relationships with one another are soon tested when Vance is arrested and taken away for trial. This one event leads the trio to a climatic encounter that ends tragicly for all. While in the majority of the film Presley gets to display his acting ability the story is broken up with Presley singing and dancing.

results.title: Mermaids
results.creator_credit: Richard Benjamin, Patrick Palmer, Wallis Nicita, Lauren Lloyd, Palmer and Nicita/Lloyd Productions
results.brief_description: Winona Ryder plays a strict Catholic schoolgirl growing up in the conservative early sixties and saddled with the grooviest and sexiest mother in town. A very funny romantic comedy, “Mermaids” celebrates the tensions, love and agonies of mother-daughter relationships. With Bob Hoskins and featuring an outstanding performance by Cher as the free-spirited mother of a very unconventional family. Based on the book by Patty Dann.
